snippet: Judge Jerome A. Holmes of the United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit, in Denver, is seen as the swing vote in a case challenging Oklahoma’s ban on same-sex unions.
abstract: Judge Jerome A Holmes of United States Court of Appeals for 10th Circuit, in Denver, who is seen as swing vote in case challenging Oklahoma’s ban on same-sex unions, asks pointed questions in court about state's same-sex marriage ban.
lead_paragraph: Judge Jerome A. Holmes of the United States Court of Appeals for the 10th Circuit, in Denver, is seen as the swing vote in a case challenging Oklahoma’s ban on same-sex unions.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
